comments:

I presume this is happening in your host Eclipse instance?
moving to Platform/Runtime as this appears to be a classloading issue.
What do you have in your workspace?

AdvancedLauncherTab doesn't even seem to reference the ExternalModelManager
class, or the getAllModels() method (I checked HEAD and the revision in 3.1 M7).
 Line 99 in AdvancedLauncherTab is a blank line between methods in the class body.

I found it. It all started after I have installed plugin called "Continuous
Testing" available from http://pag.csail.mit.edu/continuoustesting/ . It seems
to provide its own versions of some of the Eclipse plugins (including
org.eclipse.pde.ui). Probably that's why line numbers didn't match.
The exception might have something to do with the fact that while the original
Eclipse plugin is installed as a single jar file, the modified version is
installed as a directory. I already had problems with such a scenario when
upgrading from the previous version of Eclipse (is such a scenario supported at
all?). Removing original plugin from the directory didn't help though.
After all, "Continuous Testing" is said to be compatible with 3.1M6 and not with
3.1M7. I have added its author, David Saff, to the CC list in case he is
interested. See also bug 51292.
so we should close this bug right?
OK, I'm closing it. Thanks for your help!

Yes, I'm interested.  Unfortunately, until we can get some patches applied
against Eclipse, CT ships with custom versions of several plug-ins, including
pde.ui.  Thus, it is important to use the CT version custom-built for your
current Eclipse milestone version.  I hope to have the M7 version built and
released soon.
